comments:
I get "org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles"
when having done some work inside Eclipse or at startup.

I see that there are many bug reports with this error message. 
I have got it more and more often the last days, and today 
I wasn't even able to open my workspace. I get a beautiful 
error message and the workspace is taken beautifully down, 
saving its settings and everything. No crash in the ordinary sense. 
The log dump is enclosed. However beautiful, I cannot do my work.
As I read about the other cases I read an answer that this is an OS 
problem, Eclipse cannot do anything but exit. Well, I tried to exit 
all other applications up and running, there were actually quite a 
few of them at the time, and the problem disappeared. My workspace 
is not particulary big. I have lots of memory (1.5GB).

May I get a comment to a question asked: As a former amateur 
Windows developer, I seem to remember that "out of handles" is a 
resource problem not necessarily associated to memory supply. 
The number of handles is limited. Is that the case in Win2K as well?
When you say that it is an OS problem, couldn't that be true and 
false at the same time? Couldn't the problem be Eclipse's use of SWT? 
Or the SWT's design itself? If handles are allocated all the time a 
control is in some way "defined", the number of handles 
allocated could be excessive. I think there are many ways to solve 
this problem. I know of applications that don't allocate handles before they 
are 
actually needed, e.g. when the user clicks on what looks like a control.
A screen could just be a bitmap with what looks like a lot of controls on 
it. But that is an illusion. The control looking thing is not created as 
a control until the user clicks on it. In this way the 
handles are used more carefully and sparsely.
I mean, I have often a lot of big applications up and going nowadays, 
but I never get into a similar problem. Actually this problem I haven't 
encountered since back in the Win95 days. 
So I suggest there is something intrinsic to Eclipse and/or 
SWT, caused by the way they (mis)use Windows resources.
I would be delighted if someone could reject my suspicion.

Environment:
------------
Win2K SP4 w/latest updates
j2sdk1.4.2_06
1.5 GB memory
300 GB unused HD

The "no more handles" error is usually seen when the application is leaking 
resources such as GDI objects.

Do you have a plain Eclipse SDK installation or do you have additional plugins 
installed?

You can find out who is leaking resources using the Sleak tool:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-swt-
home/dev.html#tools

It is part of the SWT design that applications must manage their own 
resources.  The reasons and philosphy are described here:

http://www.eclipse.org/articles/swt-design-2/swt-design-2.html

We do not intend to change this design decision.  Closing this bug report as 
WONTFIX.  Please identify plugins that are leaking and report bugs against the 
owners of those plugins.
